page.title: 11ECOLOGY, BOX COMMON
page.content:
{
The first record of the common dates back to the early 1600s, when it belonged to{Hazelbury Manor Estate. From this time the local people have had the right to graze their animals here and to collect fire wood.The land was bought in 1978 by the{Parish { Council}who manage it on behalf of the people of{Box.}The common is mainly used for recreation and nature study.Young beech trees are protected by rabbit guards.They will take many years to reach the size of mature trees, some of which are dying and will have to be felled.Wild orchids are also prevalent.
